item.title: Non repairs from Harringay, the slum landlord council., 18th July
item.description:
Today's date is the 18th of July 2025, hi from Mr Webster. This is the seventh time I've requested help. And I've sent pictures in every time. Nearly. Copies to fix my street. Copy Hi from Mr Webster, today's date is the 2nd of July 2025. ================================ Second problem, the flashing on top of my front porch and my neighbours porch .his Dead. So just come down and fix it i don't want to talk to you repairs team i don't want to see the people just come down surprise me fix it and do it that's it The pictures I've sent today with this e-mail shows you everything you need to do is very, very simple. Come down and do it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dorset Road, West Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trip Hazard on Pavement – EV Charging Cable at 35 Erith Crescent, RM5 3JP, 18th July
item.description:
I wish to report a safety hazard on the pavement outside 35 Erith Crescent, Romford RM5 3JP. An electric vehicle is being charged via a cable running across the public footpath from the private property to the parked car. The cable lies directly on paving slabs without any cover or warning signage, posing a trip hazard—especially to children, the elderly, people using wheelchairs or pushchairs. I believe this likely contravenes sections 137 and 178 of the Highways Act 1980, and it appears no permission has been granted for using the footway. Please investigate and act to prevent potential injuries or obstructions to the public highway. Thank you. A concerned resident

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead Fox in front garden, 18th July
item.description:
There is a dead fox in the front garden Loads of flies around it we can't open any windows it smells and the children are terrified. We are unable to take photos as there are too many flies. We have thrown a bin liner over it. We are at 37 Dylways, Denmark Hill SE5 8HN. We are council tenants
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41,43,45,47, Dylways, Dulwich Village, London

item.title: On the pavement from 56b Grove Hill Road, 18th July
item.description:
People keep allowing their dogs to defecate everyday and now it is becoming an epidemic with no conderation for anyone else. This morning I slipped on some faeces and twisted my ankle. Please can you arrange for the faeces to be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Grove Hill Road, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Shrubs are dying, 18th July
item.description:
The shrubs in the planters in Bromley town centre High Street are looking worse for wear, with some clearly dead. Please would you remove the dead shrubs and ensure the beds are watered in this hotter weather?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 104-108, High Street, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
